conclusion: Solving thermodynamics problem using PV diagram analysis
State A is at coordinates (2, 1 × 10³ Pa)
State B is at coordinates (2, 4 × 10³ Pa)
State C is at coordinates (5, 1 × 10³ Pa)
Units for volume (V) are in liters (L) and pressure (P) are in 10³ Pa
Using ideal gas law PV = nRT for calculations
Equation for comparing states: (P_A V_A) / T_A = (P_C V_C) / T_C
Known values: T_A = 200 K, P_A = 1 × 10³ Pa, V_A = 2 L, P_C = 1 × 10³ Pa, V_C = 5 L
Solving for T_C using the equation T_C = (P_C V_C / P_A V_A) × T_A
The temperature of the gas at state C is 500 K
